newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - April 1.

text.p: The Washington Post carries the following stories on its front page April 1:
WASHINGTON - In a case affecting what television programming Americans receive, the Supreme Court ruled that cable systems can be forced to carry local broadcast television stations.
DENVER - Amid extraordinarily tight security and a huge news media presence, the trial of Oklahoma City bombing suspect Timothy McVeigh opened with aggressive questioning of prospective jurors.

WASHINGTON - Investors returning from the three-day Easter weekend continued dumping stocks, pushing down the Dow Jones industrial average to its biggest two-day percentage drop since the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait in 1990.

WASHINGTON - A federal judge decided to delay until Saturday implementation of a tough new immigration law, saying he agreed with immigrant advocacy groups that the public had not been given enough time to learn about the law's complex regulations.
WASHINGTON - Scientists in Ohio have created the first artificial human chromosomes, an achievement that may someday allow doctors to alter people's genetic inheritance.
CAIRO - Arab foreign ministers urged a renewal of the business boycott of Israel and a rollback of Arab states' economic, scientific and cultural ties with the Jewish state.
